title: Christmas Edition
description: Happy Holidays introduces Christmas to Minecraft! Don't understand the Grinches, Elves and Gingerbread Men that are now roaming your world? Fret not! This guide will serve as your gateway to all things Christmas in the module, explaining the various blocks, items and mobs that you may encounter throughout your adventure!

sections.content: Every year, Christmas in Minecraft has never been a huge deal, and this because there were all the special forces of Santa working in the background to make sure it didn't interrupt your day-to-day mining and crafting. One day however, Santa didn't secure his goods properly when travelling across the Overworld, and it seems that he's littered magic and items all over the Minecraft world! Now, Gingerbread Men roam the Overworld, presents are scattered everywhere, and it seems that Christmas has truly come to Minecraft!

sections.title: Your Goal
sections.content: Santa, in lieu of this embarrassing event, has enlisted your help in gathering his items. It's your job to gather the various legendary ornaments that are scattered across the world, and fill up the Christmas Star! Once that's done, Santa will come and give you some presents, depending on how good you've been!
Santa has given you the recipe for this book to help you in this journey. It's now up to you to save Christmas as best you can!

Welcome to Christmas! This book will guide you through the content added by the mod to Minecraft! The mod has also added achievements for you to unlock and follow along, so you don't get lost in various components of the holiday!

The ultimate goal of Christmas is for you to fill up the Christmas Star, a craftable block that can be filled up with any kind of ornaments. These ornaments can be gathered from various sources: from presents that spawn around the Overworld, to helping Santa's Elves gather materials for toy making! More of these will be described in the later portions of this guide.

Note that although the Christmas Star does accept any ornaments, the legendary ones give the most bonuses. Depending on the tier of the star, buffs and bonuses will be given to you, the mobs and the blocks around it, so try your best to gather as many kinds as possible!

When Santa left the task to you, he requested that you call him using this star once your job was done. Only when you get all 5 ornaments will this power be made known to you, and Santa will personally come down to thank you for all that you've done. Beware, as his mood greatly depends on how naughty or nice you've been this season...

sections.title: The Star
sections.content: The Christmas Star is a seemingly fragile yet very powerful block that is available to you to craft. Using the magic harvested from legendary ornaments, it is able to bolster your abilities and also influence Christmas blocks and mobs around it.
Christmas Stars are not cheap; they do require some rarer metals in order to craft and be used.

Christmas Stars have slots for 5 ornaments, with each ornament giving a different amount of power depending on their rarity. The amount of power corresponds to different tiers, with power level 0 having tier 0 and power level 100 having tier 5, and the other tiers correspond to power levels at intervals of 20.

At each tier, the range of the star's power and its effectiveness increases. Players get more sturdy and stronger, entities are more likely to give you items you want and even presents seem to be more lucky when broken. Don't disregard how powerful this is; it will help you greatly in the quest of trying to finish collecting the legendary ornaments!
Player wise, the star will give players a boost in health and strength, and also make sure that foods eaten will give greater healing. The healing is amplified even further for Christmas foods!

Blocks wise, blocks affected by the star's power will produce particles. Blocks such as the Present Block benefit from the star's effects by growing faster, while Candy Cane blocks have a higher tendency to drop their legendary items!

Christmas mobs are also affected by the star's power! Under the effect of the star, Grinches are unable to destroy any presents and Santa's Elves feels much more generous. All Christmas mobs also tend to drop more items, as well as having higher drop chances for their relevant ornaments!
The Christmas Star's effects are amplified even further when you obtain an Enchanted Santa's Hat and put it in the star! This can be obtained from completing the Santa event!

Once your star has reached an impressive tier, Santa will be ready to meet you and reward you accordingly. Be warned though: if you haven't been very nice this year, he might come bearing destruction instead of gifts!

You can check whether you've been naughty or nice by purchasing a Santa's List from the Santa's Elf! It's a restricted copy of Santa's naughty or nice list from the North Pole, so just make sure he doesn't find out! Right-clicking it will tell you your current naughtiness / niceness.
To summon Santa, simply click the star in the middle of the Christmas Star interface. He will arrive soon after!

At the end of Santa's visit, he will have either willingly or unwillingly given you his hat, which has been specially enchanted (and is what actually grants him the power to enter houses via chimneys even though he's quite large). This can be put into the star itself for even more power, and due to how powerful it is, many of the effects that the star has is doubled!
Ornaments are blocks that are not only for decoration, but also have a functional use with the Christmas Star.

Ornaments come in three distinct rarities that are differentiable by the colour of their name. Basic ornaments have a white colored name, rare ornaments have a cyan colored name while legendary ornaments have an orange colored name. How hard it is to get them depends on their tier, for example, Basic ornaments are easily obtained from most sources while legendary ornaments need you to complete specific tasks to obtain.

There are several different kinds of basic ornaments: baubles, big baubles, tinsel, christmas lights and christmas bells. These come in 6 unique colours, red, blue, yellow, green, gold and silver. These ornaments can be crafted with a mixture of glass, string and their respective Christmas Dye. An example of the recipes for the red coloured ornaments can be seen here:

Alphabet Ornaments are glass-made, basic ornaments that cover the entirety of the English alphabet. They can be obtained by using Glass with Stonecutters to craft Alphabet Ornament Templates, which can be crafted into their respective alphabets thereafter!
Alphabet Ornaments can also be dyed by using any kind of Christmas Dye on them; this won't consume the dye in the process!

The dyes themselves can be obtained via crafting a Dye Bowl (stick and planks), then using the Dye Bowl with their respective dye. For Gold and Silver Christmas Dyes, they use Gold and Iron Ingots respectively.
Rare ornaments come in the form of mob heads with string attached to them. They give better bonuses than basic ornaments when put in the Christmas Star, but aren't as good as legendary ornaments!
To obtain them, you can find them scattered throughout presents and occasionally, the Christmas mobs will drop them via their various interactions!

Legendary ornaments are the best kinds of ornaments you can get in the mod, but they're also the most difficult to obtain! The later chapters of this guide book details how you would go about obtaining these ornaments.
Interaction with various parts of the mobs and blocks will give you a chance to obtain these ornaments. The later chapters of this guide book details how you would go about obtaining these ornaments.

When Santa lost control of his sleigh, he accidentally sprinkled some magic onto the Overworld below as well, causing all these mobs to appear all across the world. One of them was the Gingerbread Man, a friendly, albeit clingy passive mob that likes to roam about the Overworld. They wander about in groups, searching for purpose and trying not to get soggy.

sections.title: Sogginess
sections.content: Gingerbread Men are not exactly very sturdy fellows. Even a touch of water will cause them to turn soggy, and they can't really do anything about it! However, you can dry them off by placing them near a fire source, and they'll eventually dry up. Who knows, they might even give you some items as a reward, even a legendary ornament, maybe?

Gingerbread Men are generally scared of water, and holding a water bucket does not signal that you're friendly. Soggy Gingerbread Men do like the warmth of heated blocks though! They'll follow you around in those cases in order to try to get warm!

Gingerbread Men will drop their dough when killed, or as a gift to players who have aided them. These pieces of dough can be crafted into Blocks of Gingerbread Dough, or cooked directly to obtain Gingerbread Cookies.
Gingerbread Blocks are relatively sturdy blocks that can be used for building, although they have the same weakness as their mob counterparts: water.

Gingerbread Blocks that come into contact with water will turn soggy. Blocks of Gingerbread Dough can be cooked to obtain Blocks of Gingerbread. Blocks of Soggy Gingerbread can also be reheated to dry them.
Gingerbread Blocks also come in three main variants: Block, Bricks and Tiles, along with their slabs / stairs / walls! Use them to build wonderful, Christmas-y structures!

Candy Canes were another item that fell off Santa's sleigh during the incident. They are tasty, craftable blocks that crumble into candy cane when broken. They also sometimes like to drop enchanted candy canes that have special uses!

Candy Cane blocks are different in a way though; due to their crumbly nature, they tend to respond better when destroyed by explosions as compared to players mining them! There's a higher chance for these explosions to produce Enchanted Candy Canes, and even more so if the source of the explosion was natural!
Candy Cane blocks also have their own variants: Blocks, Bricks and Tiles! Alongside them are their slabs / stairs / walls as well!

Enchanted Candy Canes are a special, enchanted item that may drop when candy cane blocks are destroyed. They have various uses: they can be crafted into a legendary ornament with a piece of string, or can be put together with a bell to summon one of Santa's elves!
As the sleigh tossed and turned, the many presents that Santa was carrying scattered across the Minecraft world, littering the entire landscape with them!
These presents can be found only in the Overworld. Presents come in small clumps (similar to pumpkins), and have three stages of growth: baby, adult and elder.

As long as they don't have leaves directly above them, these presents are able to grow and in the process are able to hold more items for players to gather. These presents hold ornaments, sheet music amongst other items that were bound for the North Pole. They might even have higher chances to give better goodies, such as their legendary ornament!

Presents are very easily broken, and as a result breaking them causes them to tear apart into scraps. These scraps can be put together again to create a baby present that's ready to be grown once again! Larger presents will drop more scraps when broken!

The Grinch has been lurking in the Overworld of Minecraft, but hasn't seen a need to come out, until now! You'd better do your best to protect your presents; the Grinch will take any opportunity he gets to sneak up on them and break them to ruin Christmas! He's scared of players, so being around him will cause him to run away and stop anything he might be doing.
Moreover, the Grinch seems to succumb to the effect of the Christmas Star. Under its effect, it seems that he becomes less willing to break presents...
Although, the Grinch hasn't really seen the beauty of Christmas yet. Maybe wrapping a gift for him might not be such a bad thing. Who knows, you might even get some goodies in return from him!

Don't forget, Santa is also all-knowing. Doing these kinds of nice things for other will certainly boost your niceness rating! On the other hand, being hostile will probably not bode well for your naughtiness rating...
Santa's Elves have always stayed in the North Pole, toiling away in his workshop to prepare presents for the rest of the world.

However, due to the incident, it seems that they don't have enough materials to carry out their job! They've dispatched a few of them down to the world of Minecraft to gather whatever materials they can, attempting to earn money to recoup their losses.

Santa's Elves don't really have time to muddle about though; they do still have a job to do back at the North Pole. However, whenever you want to speak to one, be it to buy ornaments, sheet music or food, they'll be there in an instant!
You can call one down by ringing the Santa's Elf Bell, craftable using an Enchanted Candy Cane and a bell.
These Elves will go for any emeralds they see; they'll chase any that you might have dropped on the ground!

Santa's workshop generally needs a lot of emeralds to purchase materials for their toy production. As a result, these elves are travelling across the Overworld, selling various Christmas ornaments and foods to not only spread the Christmas cheer, but also to earn some money for toy production.

On the side though, Santa's Elves have been smuggling out restricted copies of Santa's naughty or nice list; you could probably get one from them to check out whether you're in Santa's good books or not!

Santa's Elves also do need your help in getting some of the items they need; they bring along with them a 'Toy Part Request', which is a list of items they need for building some of the toys in the North Pole. They're kind of in a hurry though, so they'll need you to complete it before they leave!

They aren't that stingy though; they know that this isn't a very easy job to do, and as such have brought along Christmas goodies and enchanted tools to reward you when you're done! They may even give you a special legendary ornament!
Santa will also definitely hear about good deeds like these from his beloved elves, so helping them wouldn't be such a bad thing if you wanted to get into his good books!
Once you've finished helping Santa after summoning him via the Christmas Star, Santa's Elf will be told by Santa to start retrieving the ornaments that have been dropped around the world.
The Elves will begin to buy back any basic and rare ornaments you may have for emeralds. Use this opportunity to earn some cash on the side!

Where's the fun in Christmas if you can't give others some goodies for them to enjoy? Using a gift wrapper, you'll be able to wrap anything your heart desires and give it to others. Shake the gift fully to find out what others have given you!

sections.title: Giving the Grinch a Gift
sections.content: Other players aren't the only ones who need a gift this Christmas! The Grinch is one grouchy dude; giving him a gift might lighten him up a little and he might even give you something in return!
Along with all the ornaments and goodies Santa dropped was the Music Box. The Music Box allows you to play Christmas music, and can be easily crafted following this recipe:

The Music Box acts as a storage and a music player for Sheet Music! Depending on how you've placed the Sheet Music inside the Music Box, it will play the music according to the order (left to right, top to bottom).
It also allows you to loop through the playlist once it's finished playing! Use it to set the mood of the area for a more Christmas-y feel!
There are a total of 16 unique pieces of sheet music that exist in the hands of mobs or the presents; can you collect all 16 of them?

chapters.title: Stockings, Christmas Wreaths and Other Decorations

sections.content: Alongside the other ornaments are some non-ornament ornament-like items, such as Christmas stockings! These stockings are placeable on solid walls, and during the night they have a chance to be filled up with random goodies!
You might want to try placing them near Santa's favourite snack, Milk and Cookies. They say that it gets him to come more often...
You might come across Enchanted Threads from the various Christmas interactions. These are special pieces of Thread that can be used to upgrade your existing stockings!
Right-clicking a stocking with an Enchanted Thread will cause it to be upgraded, and give more goodies when it is filled!
To retrieve the Enchanted Thread, simply use a set of Shears and cut it right off! Breaking it using Shears will also give you the stocking and the Enchanted Thread!
Christmas Wreaths are another ornament-like block (but not an ornament) that can be placed on surfaces for decoration! They can be crafted using the following recipe:
Frost is another Christmas block that you can use to add a wintry feel to your neighbourhood! Simply get a bunch of ice, and you can follow how Glass Panes are crafted to obtain a bunch of Frost!
Alongside the various decorations and items that Santa has dropped across the Overworld, there have also been a bunch of Christmas foods that were on the sleigh as well!
These foods can be obtained from Santa's Elf who has brought some down from the North Pole. The recipes are also available to you when you discover Mistletoe and Holly!
Some of the recipes can be seen here:

This last chapter is dedicated to the jolly man. Santa is usually quite a relaxed guy, and tends to stay up north most of the year, planning for the annual Christmas season. Once in awhile however, he'll need to travel across the world to gather some items or meet some important people.
He's usually more careful and secretive about his presence, but it seems that this time, he's gotten a lot less sneaky!

Santa keeps track of how naughty or nice every Minecrafter has been during the season. He makes it simple: any time you kill an innocent being, you will become slightly naughtier. Any time you kill a being that deserves it, you will become slightly nicer. Helping the Grinch or the Elf will also put you in his good books.
Be warned though: don't harm his elves, or he'll come at you with a vengeance seen nowhere else!
Each player has a naughty-nice meter, and depending on the collective naughtiness and niceness of all players present, it'll determine whether Santa will come happy or angry!
Santa's Elf has snuck a few copies of Santa's List out from the North Pole to earn some cash on the side; if you'd like, you could get one from him!

Happy Santa is the kind of guy you'd want in the middle of a nice town square, paying a visit to the residents and bringing presents along the way. He comes with a bunch of gifts to reward your excellent help and behaviour!

Angry Santa is the kind of guy they would usually lock up. He's been experimenting A LOT with pyrotechnics and explosives, and he does have a slight anger issue, so you may want to be ready to deal with his bad temper...
Note: Knocking him out means that he will tend to drop more goodies for you!

Whichever way it goes, Santa will wake up back in the North Pole at the end, forgetting everything that happened, including your naughtiness or niceness! This means that you have a chance to prove yourself again to Santa!
Also, don't miss out on the Enchanted Santa Hat that he always carries on him!
Another one of Santa's magical equipment has been found: Snow Globes! Snow Globes are a special, legendary item that can only be obtained as a rare drop from presents.
These Snow Globes allow you to control the weather, turning bright days into rainy and even thunderstorms if used again!
Snow Globes need to be charged when first obtained. Charging can be done by using it on a full cauldron of Powder Snow. The Snow Globe can hold a maximum of 5 charges.
This guide should serve as a good starter for a lot of the content that has been added for Christmas. Hopefully you do enjoy everything that has been added here!
Special thanks to E, who has always been supportive of the development of this mod and its various features. She was a big help in the ideation and features within this Christmas edition.
